page.title: 08THE CAMP SITE
page.content: A Midhurst dentist died and left land to the Camping Club. He wished it to remain unspoilt and so the marvellous walks attract the campers. The camp site was established in 1947. People come from all over the world for their holidays. In the season they have about 1000 people a week and we supply the people with water, showers and toilets. They have more caravans than tents and we allow dogs if they are kept on leads. There is a small playground & a small shop selling gas & general groceries. Tree roots are a problem to tents & there is no electricity, but a cable has been laid. Washing and toilet facilities were put in 3 years ago. It is the only camp site in the world that has a bronze age tumulas on site. There is a resident warden for 7 months of the year.
